title: vet: bad printf errors
body:
If I run vet with a specific checker (e.g. -printf), but the specified files can't be
typechecked (e.g. because they aren't built with the go tool), then vet is far too
noisy, complaining about "can't find import ...", consequent "undeclared
name: ...", and so on.

I think vet should be less noisy in general when typechecking fails, but even more so
when a specific checker (e.g. -printf) is used. There would be less precision, but
that's okay.
